description: a(1)=1; for k>0, if n is k-almost prime then a(n) = number of k-almost primes <= n.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
formula: Ordinal transform of A001222 (bigomega). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Aug 28 2006
example: 3 is prime, so a(3)=2. 10 is 2-almost prime (semiprime), so a(10)=4.
maple: p:= proc() 0 end:a:= proc(n) option remember; local t;      t:= numtheory[bigomega](n);      p(t):= p(t)+1    end:seq(a(n), n=1..100);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 09 2015
author: _Naohiro Nomoto_, Jan 11 2001
